page.title: 08LIVING AT BERE FERRERS
page.content: A teenage boy from Bere Ferrers invited his friend from Plymouth to stay.This was their ensuing conversation: Plymothian:What a dump you live in! Bere Ferrers Boy:The guide book says it's a "charming riverside village" P:There's nothing to do here. B.F.B.:There are lots of things to do. P.:What, a knitting evening with the W.I.? B.F.B.:Well, firstly, now I have my licence, I can go salmon fishing on the River Tavy. P:What's so good about salmon fishing? B.F.B:They taste delicious. P: Is that all you can do here? B.F.B:Well, it's a brilliant place for wildfowl and I'm a keen bird watcher. P:There's a greater choice of "birds"in Plymouth, mate!
